channel.title: Summary :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter, we reviewed the Document Object Model (the DOM), the tree-like structure of HTML elements built by the browser as it parses an HTML document. We discussed how CSS rules are applied to nodes in this tree to determine how the final webpage will be rendered, and how JavaScript can be used to manipulate and transform the DOM (and the resulting webpage appearance). We also discussed how JavaScript events work, and how this event-driven approach is the basis for implementing concurrency within the language.
